camel.sink.endpoint.apiVersion.name: camel.sink.endpoint.apiVersion
camel.sink.endpoint.apiVersion.description: The Kubernetes API Version to use

camel.sink.endpoint.dnsDomain.name: camel.sink.endpoint.dnsDomain
camel.sink.endpoint.dnsDomain.description: The dns domain, used for ServiceCall EIP

camel.sink.endpoint.kubernetesClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.kubernetesClient
camel.sink.endpoint.kubernetesClient.description: Default KubernetesClient to use if provided

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: Producer operation to do on Kubernetes

camel.sink.endpoint.portName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.portName
camel.sink.endpoint.portName.description: The port name, used for ServiceCall EIP

camel.sink.endpoint.portProtocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.portProtocol
camel.sink.endpoint.portProtocol.description: The port protocol, used for ServiceCall EIP

camel.sink.endpoint.connectionTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.connectionTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.connectionTimeout.description: Connection timeout in milliseconds to use when making requests to the Kubernetes API server.

camel.sink.endpoint.clientKeyAlgo.name: camel.sink.endpoint.clientKeyAlgo
camel.sink.endpoint.clientKeyAlgo.description: The Key Algorithm used by the client

camel.sink.endpoint.trustCerts.name: camel.sink.endpoint.trustCerts
camel.sink.endpoint.trustCerts.description: Define if the certs we used are trusted anyway or not

camel.component.kubernetes-secrets.lazyS.name: camel.component.kubernetes-secrets.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.kubernetes-secrets.lazyS.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.kubernetes-secrets.autow.name: camel.component.kubernetes-secrets.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.kubernetes-secrets.autow.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
